website_summaries.verdict: The HTC One Remix might not be cutting edge, but it delivers upscale design in a manageable size for a reasonable price, and that makes it a great midrange Android smartphone on Verizon.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good Phone, and return was Easy, Vendor was assisrive, Reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of the HTC One Remix, I wanted another, as my existing HTC One Remix was getting worn out, and battery was deteriorating. This one I purchased was indecent shape, and thought that data transfer would be a snap. Well it didn't perform quite as well, data transfer really slow, and didn't get all my apps either, it too was slow, and had to manually load my Apps. The phone kept getting warner to touch, just my observation, my other phone didn't get quite as warm. The Vendor contacted me via email and provided a return mailing label.
customer_reviews.author: MARK W.

customer_reviews.title: Comes as the picture as shown very sleek. Although ...
customer_reviews.text: Comes as the picture as shown very sleek. Although, time come to activate. Activation went well as any other verizon pre paid plan. Then I had trouble getting rid of the VZW Demo. I don't know if that has to do with verizon (Verizon Store Demo Mode) I just disabled the demo app but it would re download itself. Not sure if I'm the only one having this problem. If anyone knows how to fix that; let me know. Greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the phone and within 5 months I started notice problems. Slow loading information, getting stuck, and battery life shortening. In addition the volume on the phone for calls is lower than I anticipated. It's nice for looks and for basic functions however.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it instead of the HTC One M8 (Android Version). I used it for a while until the Note 5 came out. It was a good phone for the price $75. I gave it to my daughter to replace a Droid Mini that the battery is going bad. My daughter (age 18) likes it but this phone does not have Qi charging or HD Voice like the Droid Mini. She still loves the phone and does everything she needs it to do. When I had the phone it was VERY difficult to keep it rooted. The phone was easy to root because it is Kitkat 4.4 (and will never go any higher) but keeping root was nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good. I wish the phone had better battery life, but otherwise I'm completely satisfied.

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone! Basically a smaller m8 aside from the much more reasonable size and some small features. Great size and feels and is very well made. It has a smaller processor but you can hardly tell unless your playing extremely big games, but it still is a great phone for the average here and there gamer. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Fatally Flawed and common at that
customer_reviews.text: Microphone became muted after two months of use. Searched the internet and found out this IS a common on-going problem not only for this phone but other HTC phones as well. You would thing a problem this widespread HTC would provide some sort of sw fix but none is out there that I can find, only temporary hacks that may work for a little while then you have to hack it again. Tried many hacks, wasted much time. Other than this it's a nice phone.
customer_reviews.author: mountainman

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an HTC Incredible 2 for years without any problems. When it finally came time to replace I knew it was going to be an HTC. Love this phone & all the new features my old one didn't have. Size is just about right & plenty fast for me.

customer_reviews.title: A solid phone you won't regret
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone except for the sounds settings and the mass text settings. To change between vibrate and silent you have to go into the settings, you can't just use the buttons on the side. And to send a mass text, to add recipients you can't go down the list of contacts and check them off, it only lets you add one recipient at a time. Other than that, I really like how this phone handles and that the screen isn't insanely big. It doesn't seem to lag which was my largest problem with my last phone. It also has really good cameras, both forward facing and rear.
